adjective.description: (especially of humor) having or showing a sharp or critical quality; biting.

noun.description: A substance, typically an inorganic oxide, that combines with a dye or stain and thereby fixes it in a material.

verb.description: Impregnate or treat (a fabric) with a mordant.

origin: Late 15th century: from French, present participle of mordre to bite, from Latin mordere.
